data.title: FC Barcelona Set To Receive Saudi Arabia Cash Windfall
data.meta_description: FC Barcelona will receive a much-needed cash windfall from Saudi Arabia, as highlighted by Catalan publications such as SPORT.
data.text:
FC Barcelona will receive a much-needed cash windfall from Saudi Arabia, as highlighted by Spanish publications such as MARCA.

Xavi Hernandez's troops head to the Middle East this week to get the defense of their Super Cup underway.

The first piece of silverware in Xavi's reign was granted this time last year, when the Blaugrana beat bitter rivals Real Madrid 3-1 in the final thanks to a goal-and-assist masterclass from Player of the Match Gavi.

And while the youngster won't be on hand to try and help his team reclaim the title, thanks to an ACL tear picked up on international duty, Barca could once again meet Madrid for a Saudi episode of El Clasico in the last dance.

This is because Barca has been pitted against 2022/2023's Copa del Rey runners-up Osasuna in the semi-finals on Thursday, with an all-Spanish capital derby between Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid scheduled the day before that.

More than the chance for bragging rights is up for grabs, however.

As pointed out by SPORT, the Spanish football federation known as the RFEF receives a handsome $43.8 million (€40 million) annually from the Saudis for having its competition played in their kingdom.

This time round, for the Super Cup's 40th edition, just over half of that sum at $23 million (€21 million) will be distributed among the four teams taking part.

As the two biggest clubs in Spain - if not the world - who are pretty much guaranteed to participate every year if they win or finish runners-up in either league or the Copa del Rey, Barca and Real Madrid will be paid $6.6 million (€6 million) each.

In comparison, Atleti is due half that amount and Osasuna a paltry $880,000 (€880,000).

There is also an extra $1.1 million (€1 million) on the line for the two teams that reach the final, with $821,000 (€750,000) going to the outfits that are sent home early.

After that, at least a further $550,000 (€500,000) can be claimed by the winner.

And if Barca can repeat their success of 2023 and go all the way, they will earn a much-needed $8.5 million (€7.8 million) in prize money that would greatly help them navigate Financial Fair Play and perhaps make summer signings.
